intro: Hieracium laxanthelium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features upright stems with basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium laxanthelium is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
